HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.WM.content: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

HDG.FS.content: “what is proper to all colors?” not Husserl’s question, who sought to clarify constitution of object in consciousness, phenomenologizes Kantian analysis of anticipations of perception

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
